meanings.definition: To throw or drop something from a moving vehicle or ship
meanings.sent1: The astronaut jettisoned the empty fuel tank into space.
meanings.sent2: The sailors jettisoned the damaged cargo overboard to lighten the ship.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy pirate accidentally jettisoned his hat into the ocean.
meanings.sent4: She jettisoned her worries like excess baggage, freeing herself to enjoy the journey.
meanings.sent5: The decision to jettison the old ways propelled the team forward with renewed energy.

meanings.definition: To get rid of something unnecessary or burdensome
meanings.sent1: The company jettisoned outdated equipment to make room for new technology.
meanings.sent2: He jettisoned his bad habits in order to lead a healthier lifestyle.
meanings.sent3: The magician jettisoned his old tricks and amazed the audience with new illusions.
meanings.sent4: She jettisoned toxic relationships, surrounding herself with positivity.
meanings.sent5: The community jettisoned negativity, embracing a culture of kindness and support.
